PLEASE READ BEFORE DOWNLOADING
I worked extremely hard to earn $800 through my Shopify website, only for Shopify to **hold my funds for months**. After months of trying to prove my legitimacy, Shopify finally reactivated my account ‚Äî but when I logged in, I was told to **update my banking info**, which required me to **pay for another subscription** just to access it. That‚Äôs another **$40 gone** on top of everything else.

Now my payout has been pushed to **November 15**, after already being delayed from **October 28**, and based on how this has gone, I doubt I‚Äôll get it on time or even at all.

I‚Äôm a parent of **three children**, and this situation has been financially and emotionally exhausting. I‚Äôm the only one working, and I‚Äôve had to stop all business operations while waiting for Shopify to release money that I rightfully earned. Holding someone‚Äôs income this long ‚Äî especially after proving compliance ‚Äî is unacceptable and feels borderline illegal. My sales included service which required some labor work to be done. At this point, all I can do is share my experience and leave this **hard-earned 1-star review**, because Shopify has given me no other option. author: QueenStacieD
title: Account Recovery Process Stressful
content: Recently I had to get a new phone number, I was able to sign in on my computer but forgot to update the number on my Shopify account. Then to my already stressful life my computer‚Äôs hard drive crashed. I was unable to recovery my recovery codes or sign into my Shopify account from my new computer or phone. I contacted Shopify support, which in itself was even more stressful because to reach someone you had to select your store to sign in and I could not. After a few hours, I was finally able to reach someone by chat. I was informed that they would be submitting an account recovery request but there was no timeline on resolution. Two weeks later I got an email to submit documentation to validate that I am the owner. I submitted the documents and hoped that over the next 48-72 hours I would hear something. It has now been another week with no further responses. I am unable to access orders to fulfill, resulting in a loss in revenue which I informed the agent this fact when requesting account recovery. There simply should be a much better process for account recovery with such a large corporation, and business owner‚Äôs entire business livelihood attached to the platform. I‚Äôm likely going to have to refund any and all sales and possibly have to send out some sort of discount and apology to ensure I retain customers. I am still being charged the fees for a service I can‚Äôt use and losing money. I‚Äôve been with Shopify since 2018 and I never considered this process would be so complicated and lengthy. I am now likely going to seek another more reliable platform that considers the urgency for these sort of issues. I suggest saving your recovery codes offline, print them, or save to a cloud platform that you can always access. Luckily I have Etsy and have been able to redirect some customers to this option to shop our products.
